channel.title: How to Upgrade Salix 13.0 to 13.1 :: Salix Documentation
channel.description: Preparing for the upgrade You first need to change the default repositories to the ones for Slackware and Salix 13.1. Open file /etc/slapt-get/slapt-getrc and change all “13.0” instances to “13.1”. Also make sure the Slackware repositories have an OFFICIAL priority. Example setups are show below: i486 architecture SOURCE=http://salix.enialis.net/i486/slackware-13.1/:OFFICIAL SOURCE=http://salix.enialis.net/i486/slackware-13.1/extra/:OFFICIAL SOURCE=http://salix.enialis.net/i486/13.1/:PREFERREDx86_64 architecture SOURCE=http://salix.enialis.net/x86_64/slackware-13.1/:OFFICIAL SOURCE=http://salix.enialis.net/x86_64/slackware-13.1/extra/:OFFICIAL SOURCE=http://salix.enialis.net/x86_64/13.1/:PREFERREDAfter you make the changes, run slapt-get -uUpgrading packages It’s always safer to upgrade your glibc package first:
